Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Welcome, everyone, to this year's <RED>Wild Safari</RED>
tour. I hope you'll all have a rousing time
exploring the wildlife today.
<PAGE>
Now, allow me to introduce our guide, Agate.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hi everyone! My name is Agate, and I'll be your
tour guide today. Are you tooootally ready to see
some awesome animals? 
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Let's begin by visiting the pasture!

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is the pasture area, White Clover Fields.
Farmers can bring their livestock here and let
them graze in the pasture.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>There's always a whole lot of juicy green grass
to enjoy. The livestock animals love hanging out
here!

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Next, we move into the mysterious mountain
area!
<PAGE>
It may look steep, craggy and kind of bleak, but
many animal species feel right at home in this
kind of environment.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now, we come to the lake area. Here, you can
see several different varieties of waterfowl in
their natural habitat.
<PAGE>
Visitors can also fish or swim in the lake. I speak
from personal experience when I say it's a ton of
fun to go swimming with the duckies.
<PAGE>
Beyond the lake is the mine. You can find quite
a variety of minerals, ores and gems there.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Over here, you'll see the enormous tree that
serves as the defining landmark of our forest
area.
<PAGE>
Birds and other arboreal animals make their
home here. But remember, no climbing the trees
here. They're just for the animals here.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You may have noticed a precipitous drop in
temperature just now. In other words...it's sure
cold! This last area is our glacier area.
<PAGE>
This enormous glacier was imported directly
from the far north.
<PAGE>
Here, you can see species that feel perfectly at
home in the icy lands of year-round winter
where the snow never fully melts.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
There are also some boars that call this field
home.
<PAGE>
It's really awesome to roam around the field with
a majestic boar at your side.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The cave you see in the side of that mountain is
the home of our bears.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Mr. Bear and his bear buddies are actually quite
small and gentle; really not scary at all. Please
be nice to them.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
The stars of this area are none other than the
stern-faced Mr. Shoebill Stork and his friends.
They may look grumpy, but they're really lovable.
<PAGE>
They can stay still for really long periods of time,
so we've had people mistake them for statues
before!

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, yes! A rare species of monkey lives right
there in the big tree. It's called a White Sifaka.
<PAGE>
It looks really cute when it comes down out of
the tree and tries to run around on the ground.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
And I'm sure the first critter that pops into
everyone's mind is the penguin! Yes indeedy, we
do have a cute little penguin who lives here.
<PAGE>
It's very friendly, so please be extra nice with it.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
The bird you see dancing up in the trees is...you
guessed it, a parrot.
<PAGE>
Our Mr. Parrot doesn't mimic people's voices,
but he's quite the little joker, so be sure to watch
him when you visit.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Please don't get too close to Mr. Polar Bear.
<PAGE>
I know he looks really cuddly, but he has very,
very sharp claws, and paws as big as your head.
It's best to admire him from a distance.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
And that was our last area, bringing us to the
end of our Wild Safari. Thank you for joining us,
and I hope you all had a great time!

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, let me calculate the total amount we
received from ticket sales.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This time, it was <MOJI0>G per person, and we had
<MOJI1> people on the tour, for a total of <BLUE><MOJI2></BLUE>G.
<PAGE>
I'll have this amount added to your wallet later.
Thank you very much for putting this together
for us today.
